data.title: Theatre Travel Series
data.text:
Stratford Festival • Ontario, Canada

June 20 – 24, 2018

For any theatre buff, Stratford Festival is a must. And, what better way to experience it than with a senior member of Hartford Stage’s award-winning artistic staff?

Dear theatre buff,

We are excited to offer a four-day excursion, June 20–24, 2018, to the Stratford Festival, North America’s largest classical repertory theatre company located in Ontario, Canada. The Stratford Festival is an internationally recognized venue which brings highly regarded artists, directors, and designers from around the world to produce classics and contemporary dramas and musicals, with a special emphasis on the plays of Shakespeare. This trip includes premiere tickets to five productions, conversations and meals with guest artists from Stratford, and attendance at the Opening Night performance and cast party of Coriolanus.

Our trip is curated by Hartford Stage Associate Artistic Director Elizabeth Williamson, who will lead discussions during the trip (and provide advance reading materials for the lifelong scholars in the group).

As you can imagine, this is a one-of-a-kind experience which provides insightful knowledge and dramaturgy about the plays and productions. It will be a deep dive into some of the best theatre productions in the world with some of the most thrilling theatre artists alive today.

We hope you will join us for this exciting trip in June!

Yours truly,

Antay Bilgutay

Director of Development

(860) 520-7249

Sign Up Now!

The cost

$3,500 Single Occupancy (1 King Bed) / $5,500 Double Occupancy (1 King Bed or divided Twin)

Airfare and local transportation not included. This trip is based on a minimum of 12 participants and maximum of 20 participants.

DEPOSITS AND FINAL PAYMENTS

A $1,000 per person deposit is required along with a completed Reservation Form to reserve a place on this trip. Deposit and Reservation Form are due by Friday, February 23, 2018. Deposit is non-refundable.

Final Payments are due no later than Friday, March 2, 2018. Invoices for final payments will be sent two weeks post-deposit. $1,000 of trip expenses per person will be considered tax-deductible.

Checks should be made payable to Hartford Stage. Please mail to Hartford Stage, Attn: Stratford Trip, 50 Church Street, Hartford, CT 06103.

The weather up there

The Stratford Festival does not have a dress code, though many patrons do like to dress up for the occasion. They ask you to consider bringing a light sweater or jacket, as the theatres are air-conditioned. They ask you also to consider using scented products sparingly, or foregoing them altogether for comfort of other patrons. The temperature for June in Stratford f|uctuates between 50-70 degrees.

View the Itinerary*

*Subject to change.

The festival

THE TEMPEST

Forgive and be free.

In Shakespeare’s great drama of loss and reconciliation, a long-deposed ruler uses magical arts to bring within her power the enemies who robbed her of her throne and marooned her on a remote island. But what revenge does she mean to take?

By William Shakespeare • Directed by Antoni Cimolino (Artistic Director, Stratford Festival)

Starring Michael Blake, Brent Carver and Martha Henry as Prospero

THE MUSIC MAN

A love story with twists. And tunes.

A charming but fraudulent salesman arrives in River City to work his usual scam—only to find that a bill of goods can be the real deal. With melodies that include the rousing “Seventy-Six Trombones,” this musical-comedy classic will delight the whole family.

By Meredith Wilson • Directed and Choreographed by Donna Feore

Starring Daren A. Herbert as Harold Hill

CORIOLANUS

The faster you rise, the harder you fall.

He’s fearless on the battlefield—but in the pitfall-laden world of politics, he’s doomed by his contempt for the common people. This stunning production by genre-defying director Robert Lepage explores the age-old tensions that still tear at the heart of democracy.

By William Shakespeare • Directed by Robert Lepage

Starring Graham Abbey, Tom Rooney and André Sills as Coriolanus

LONG DAY’S JOURNEY INTO NIGHT

Home is where the heart aches.

In this searing cry from the heart, one of the 20th century’s greatest playwrights paints a haunting portrait of his own emotionally damaged family as they struggle—under crushing burdens of guilt, resentment and dread—to maintain the unifying bonds of love.

By Eugene O’Neill • Directed by Miles Potter

Starring Seana McKenna and Scott Wentworth

BRONTË: THE WORLD WITHOUT

A sisterhood of secrecy.

Three sisters live in poverty with their ailing father and dissolute, dying brother, jealously guarding the secrets of their disappointed hearts. But desperation drives them to a life-changing choice, as they reveal the literary talents that will win them world-wide fame.

By Jordi Mand • Directed by Vanessa Porteous

World premiere commissioned by the Stratford Festival

Starring Beryl Bain

NOT INCLUDED

NOTES

Canadian law requires that all persons entering Canada carry both proof of citizenship and proof of identity. A valid U.S. passport, passport card, or NEXUS card satisfied these requirements for U.S. citizens.

If you will have a car, The Bruce Hotel offers free parking, however, there is a fee for parking at the theatres. There are multiple lots and cost is between $10-$15. There are also ample Taxi Companies including City Cabs (519.272.2222), Radio Cab (519.271.4242), and Festival Cab (519.508.8888). Carpooling and arrangements will also be coordinated when in Stratford. Please let us know if you have any questions.

Guest Artists schedules for conversations are yet to be determined. Once finalized we will share details with attendees.
